extendedInfo.description: The most powerful,  feature-packed free graphing calculator for Android. Cartesian and polar graphs, table of values, complex numbers, differentiation, integration, area, arc length, an easy-to-use units converter and choice of background color and more. â¢ Graph functions on an interval.Example: f(x) = xsin(2x) intvl=(-2, â).â¢ Graph functions, f(Î¸), using polar coordinate system too.Example: f(Î¸) = 3sin(2Î¸) intvl=(0, 2Ï).â¢ Calculate complex numbers expressions. Example: (2+3i)^i+5â  (4). You can use i or j for the imaginary unit.â¢ Generate table of values for functions. â¢ Calculate definite integral, area and arc length. â¢ Degrees and Radians mode.â¢ Units Converter - convert units of length, mass, time,... . In addition, the followings are also available on this free version (limited time)â¢ Graph parametric equations on an interval. Example: p(t) = 3cos(3t), 3sin(2t) intvl=(0, 2Ï). Note: enter x(t) and y(t) separated by a comma (no enclosing parentheses around p(t) ).â¢  Graph point sets and fit a curve by a polynomial (interpolating) of the least degree that contains the given points; find and graph the line  (least-squares line) that best fits the given points.  Example (Points):  1,2; 2,3; 4,5; Note: enter the point (x,y) as x,y;â¢ Graph parametric equations (Î¸(t), r(t)) and point sets (Î¸, r) using polar coordinate system too.Example: p(t) = 3cos(3t), 3sin(2t) intvl=(0, 2Ï). Note: enter Î¸(t) and r(t) separated by a comma as above -- the first component is Î¸(t) -- (no enclosing parentheses around p(t)).Example (Points):  1,2; Ï,3; Ï/2,5; Note: The first component is Î¸; enter the point (Î¸,r) as Î¸,r;â¢ Calculate derivatives (symbolic) of functions and parametric curves and graph them. â¢ Solve f(x)= 0 to find all the x-intercepts (zeros or roots of a function) on an interval without guesswork. â¢ Scientific, engineering and fixed point notations.You can use the following in your expressionsâ¢ Basic algebraic operations â¢ Trigonometric functions and their inverses (RAD and DEG)â¢ Hyperbolic functions and their inverses â¢ Exponential and logarithmic functionsâ¢ Absolute value and step functions.â¢ The Gamma function.If your expression is incomplete or if you make a syntax error the = sign changes to ? mark.  When you touch it, this artificial intelligent graphing calculator gives you a feedback by precisely indicating the error.When no interval is specified, the graphing calculator automatically appends a default interval to the function or and parametric expression and draws the graph on that interval. You can change the endpoints of the interval, of course. This convenient feature is unique to the gCalcD graphing calculator. Touch Polar on the upper right of the graphing area to draw the graphs using the polar coordinate system.Touch and drag the graphs to see the required region. To center the graph on the screen, touch the coordinate indicator on the top left of the graphing area.Touch ++ or -- on the lower right corner of the graphing area to zoom in or zoom out. Touch the lower left corner of the graphing area (where the caption is) to reset zoom.On this graphing calculate most keys are assigned a second functionality by long pressing. For example* Long press of the back-space button xâ: Clears the input box. Immediately after pressing it will display back the deleted expression. * Long press of ^ (power) sign: Appends the 'intvl=(' to the expression if it is not already appended or deleted. Long press of decimal point inserts comma to separate the end-points.Note: You DO NOT need Internet connection to use this calculator. If you are connected, ads may be shown. You can delete ads by upgrading.All of the above with more details are included in the built-in help menu of the calculator.

reviews.title: Sampler
reviews.comment: This app is a limited demo of a truly superior 10.00 app, gCalcD. I recommend splurging, and getting the good one right away. The developer is responsive and has written a powerful, logical math app. Go for it.
reviews.author: Allen Holmes

reviews.title: Interface is a little cramped, zooming is hard.
reviews.comment: Interface is a little cramped, zooming on the graph is difficult with really small buttons and not multitouch pinch zooming.
